executive_summary: May 2025 - PREP WORK for Solar Iraq training (2 months before implementation). Bilal interviews Iraqi solar expert Hussam Hassan, reviews curriculum, refines training design for Mosul implementation. Shows systematic preparation: expert interviews → curriculum refinement → implementation (July). This is NOT ad-hoc - it's thoughtful educational design.

bilals_actual_words.professional_identity: I'm Bilal, a curriculum-development consultant. I've been working across the Middle East since the Arab Spring—helping build creative spaces and skills programs.
bilals_actual_words.mission_statement: Our goal in Mosul isn't just to teach 'green energy' theory; we want people to get jobs or launch businesses in solar. So we need a course that takes someone who already has some technical foundation—say an engineer or technician—and gives them the know-how and the business sense to earn a living in the sector.
bilals_actual_words.practical_focus: Right now I'm looking for trainers like you. Our goal in Mosul isn't just to teach 'green energy' theory; we want people to get jobs or launch businesses in solar.
bilals_actual_words.implementation_timeline: I'll be in Mosul mid-July—hope we can meet.

significance: CRITICAL TIMELINE EVIDENCE - Shows 2-month preparation cycle for Solar Iraq: May (expert interviews, curriculum refinement) → July (implementation). Validates educational mission + MENA trajectory + systematic approach.

iaps_identified.description: Professional curriculum development for Solar Iraq training
iaps_identified.context: Preparing training program for Mosul delivery in July 2025
iaps_identified.note: IAP but serves educational mission (borderline CAP transformation)

sarec.assessment: Strong evidence of outcome-focused educational design
sarec.reasoning: Explicitly states goal is jobs/businesses, not just theory
evidence: 'want people to get jobs or launch businesses in solar'
'takes someone... and gives them the know-how and the business sense to earn a living'
Interviews expert to ensure practical relevance
Connects to Five One Labs work (BMC ERP #7) - both employment-focused

sarec.reasoning: Interviews Iraqi expert 2 months before delivery, refines curriculum based on feedback
evidence: Seeks expert with local experience (Hussam: RENAC, Baghdad-based)

timeline_connection.may_2025: This conversation - expert interviews, curriculum refinement
timeline_connection.pattern: 16-month sustained Iraq trajectory with systematic preparation

analyst_notes.significance: This conversation reveals Bilal's PROFESSIONAL IDENTITY and SYSTEMATIC APPROACH. Not just delivering training - doing expert interviews, curriculum refinement, local context research. This is professional-level educational design, not amateur volunteer work.
analyst_notes.iraq_timeline_deepening: Iraq trajectory now spans: March 2024 (Wastewater) → May 2025 (Solar prep) → July 2025 (Solar delivery). 16 months of sustained engagement with systematic preparation.
analyst_notes.educational_mission_clarity: The quote 'want people to get jobs or launch businesses' shows educational mission is OUTCOMES-FOCUSED (employment, entrepreneurship) not KNOWLEDGE-FOCUSED (just teach theory). This is capacity-building, not academic.
analyst_notes.mena_professional_identity: Self-describes as 'working across the Middle East since the Arab Spring' - establishes MENA work as long-term professional identity, not recent development.
